metadata.subject: The J.P. Morgan View: Local forces are dominating

relationships.description: Financial institution providing market analysis and investment advice to clients
Analyst/strategist at JPMorgan Chase Bank NA
Analyst/strategist at J.P. Morgan Securities plc

analysis.purpose: To provide J.P. Morgan's market analysis and investment recommendations to clients
analysis.significance: Regular financial market commentary from a major investment bank during a period of European banking crisis (Cyprus) and global market uncertainty

notable_quotes: "Risk-on, risk-off is so last year" - describing the shift from global market correlations to localized investment opportunities
"The imposition of capital controls on Cypriot deposits is to be sure a watershed moment" - assessing the significance of the Cyprus banking crisis
"the 3-decade long rally in bonds is likely over" - major market call about the end of a long-term bond bull market

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this financial market analysis document

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is legitimate financial market analysis and investment advice

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be standard financial market commentary that would typically be distributed to clients and potentially covered by financial media. The Cyprus banking crisis was widely reported in 2013.

analysis.summary: J.P. Morgan's weekly market analysis email discussing investment strategies amid the Cyprus banking crisis, emphasizing that local economic forces rather than global themes are driving market opportunities, with specific recommendations for equities, fixed income, currencies, and commodities across various regions.
